Is arcreader supposed to return the offset of the URL record (ex.
http://ww=
w.dryswamp.edu:80/index.html 127.10.100.2 19961104142103
text/html 202) or =
the first line of the header (ex.  HTTP/1.0 200
Document follows)?

When yo=
u use the output of arcreader to read the file from the offset
it  gives, t=
he offset starts at the beginning of the URL record line.
If you read the e=
xact size of the file that arcreader returns,
beginning at the offset it re=
turns, it cuts off the end of the file by
exactly the length of the URL rec=
ord line (the first line).

Is that how it is supposed to work?
